title: F/S Johnny Evers Chicago Jersey SGC 80/6
author: jamest206

posts.post_title: F/S Johnny Evers Chicago Jersey SGC 80/6
posts.post_content: Putting this up two weeks before it goes on Ebay. $2,500 No lowballing please!!!   Probably see who comes close to what I am hoping for, and I am not basing my pricing off what I see on Ebay either.    I am asking something reasonable, but want to see what offers come in.   Thanks, James
Correct me if I'm wrong, but I thought we needed to list a price for a card that is "for sale." Not really sure where the most appropriate place to put a "deal or no deal" style listing.

[quote name="jamest206" post=2036749]Added pricing  Thanks![/QUOTE]

Good luck man. Nice card
Thanks, probably the nicest card I have ever owned.
Wow very nice card good luck with it..

I am getting the vibe people think I’m wanting an arm and a leg for this card.  It’s currently on eBay. I only see two cards in better condition, and one is debatable, could be a tie. Very beautiful card.  I would be happy getting $2,500 for it, or make me an offer on here or eBay.  I ship everything FedEx 2nd day.

[quote name="wazoo" post=2036752]Good luck man. Nice card[/QUOTE]

We have never mandated a price be given. It isn't a problem unless it's a problem. The fewer rules the better.

[quote name="jamest206" post=2040130]I am getting the vibe people think I’m wanting an arm and a leg for this card.[/QUOTE]

I feel you are soliciting opinions ... it sold on ebay less than 2 weeks ago (3 days before you started this thread) for $865 via best offer.  The picture you posted is the exact one from the ebay listing.  You are asking for 3x the price and saying no lowball offers. The vibe you are feeling is correct.

[URL="https://www.ebay.com/itm/1909-T206-Sweet-Caporal-JOHNNY-EVERS-WITH-BAT-CHICAGO-ON-SHIRT-SGC-80-6-/382715484206"]https://www.ebay.com/itm/1909-T206-Sweet-Caporal-JOHNNY-EVERS-WITH-BAT-CHICAGO-ON-SHIRT-SGC-80-6-/382715484206[/URL]

[quote name="jamest206" post=2040130]I would be happy getting $2,500 for it[/QUOTE]

I bet you would.

[quote name="tiger8mush" post=2040161]I feel you are soliciting opinions ... it sold on ebay less than 2 weeks ago (3 days before you started this thread) for $865 via best offer.  The picture you posted is the exact one from the ebay listing.  You are asking for 3x the price and saying no lowball offers. The vibe you are feeling is correct.[/QUOTE]

ooops!

No different than flipping a house.  I saw a deal, and selling it at below its value, so I can build my collection.  No shame in my game. I’ve sold plenty of cards under what I paid.  This is a sellers buyers traders forum. My pictures on eBay are in possession at my house.  I’m sure all the guys I’ve been generous in selling to aren’t complaining about me on here or eBay.  Thanks for the input though!!!  I’m definitely not asking an arm and a leg, and would definitely like $2500 for it. It looks way better in person, and laying next to the PSA 3 I bought and sold for under what I paid, you can see how valuable it is.

[url]https://www.ebay.com/itm/T206-Johnny-Evers-Chicago-Jersey-SGC-80-6-Flawless/353296030825?hash=item5242159c69:g:FJMAAOSwuXJfwb4V[/url]

That’s my current posting on eBay.  Full disclosure.

+1.  Arm, leg, & the whole cadaver
..

Again, look at my eBay posting.  Not defending myself, but I’m pretty sure my eBay post isn’t asking or coming close to what I’m “hoping” for.  The only thing I’m doing is buying and selling for my collection. You can use the same documentation on eBay to see a few I’ve sold there, and what I sold them for.  I can also see what I’ve sold on here for below what I paid, and what the buyers turn around and ask for.  I’m not doing this to get rich, or anything like that.  Just collect, and enjoy what the set has to offer. Anyone is welcome to bid, as it’s not exactly asking for more than what I paid for on eBay right now.....
